sentences.english: His car got bogged down and wouldn't move.
sentences.chinese: 他的車子陷入泥沼開不動了。

sentences.english: How long will it take to climb out of the hole this time?
sentences.chinese: 這次美國經濟爬出泥沼需要多長時間？

sentences.english: Jean Valjean mounted this inclined plane and reached the other side of the quagmire.
sentences.chinese: 冉阿讓走上這平坦的斜坡，就走到了泥沼的另一邊。

sentences.english: So where is gold to be dug from the widening mire ?
sentences.chinese: 那麼怎樣從不斷擴大的泥沼中挖出黃金呢？

sentences.english: The crane stood grave and still in the swamp near the mango grove.
sentences.chinese: 白鶴莊嚴而安靜地立在芒果樹旁的泥沼中。

sentences.english: He spurred on through the mud.
The heavy rain had turned the pitch into a quagmire.
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱，球場變成了泥沼。

sentences.english: "Why have you got us into this mire?, " he asked.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要讓我們陷入這樣的泥沼中？

sentences.english: Your car will bog down in the mud.
A piece of impassable bog with yield of liquid peat.
sentences.chinese: 一個不可逾越的泥沼區。

sentences.english: Gases bubbled up from the mud.
sentences.chinese: 氣泡從泥沼中冒了上來。

sentences.english: But do not fall into slough of despond.
sentences.chinese: 但不要陷入絕望的泥沼。

sentences.english: ROAD-GANG is pulling stumps, bogged down in mud.
sentences.chinese: 一隊築路的犯人在泥沼中拖動着樹樁。

sentences.english: But now Brazil is bogged down by the burden of Big Government.
sentences.chinese: 但當今大政府的負擔又讓巴西陷入泥沼。

sentences.english: Peatlands or mires are another major store of greenhouse gases.
sentences.chinese: 另外，溫室氣體主要還儲存在泥炭地或泥沼裏。

sentences.english: Alligators thrive in freshwater sloughs and marl prairies.
sentences.chinese: 鱷魚在淡水泥沼和泥灰土草地茁壯成長。

definition: to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
